meta.title: MISD
meta.p: 4/17 Update - Governor Abbott issued an executive order on Friday, April 17, determining that Texas schools will remain closed through the remainder of the 2019–2020 school year. In accordance with that order, McKinney ISD will continue our school closure through the end of school on May 28. We will begin the next school year in August in accordance with the previously adopted 2020-2021 school calendar. Learn more
All Grab & Go meal program locations (Vega, Malvern, Webb, Finch, McNeil and Slaughter) will be open on April 10th and 27th. Learn more
McKinney ISD Digital Teaching and Learning Starts Monday, March 30! Please click the following link for important components of our digital teaching and learning plan. Learn more
For digital learning, students will access the Seesaw and Canvas platforms through the McKinney ISD SSO link https://sso.mckinneyisd.net/

A parent support site, MISD Parent e-Learning Resources, has been created to assist families during digital learning with helpful information related to Seesaw, Canvas and other resources. https://sites.google.com/mckinneyisd.net/misde-learning/home

p.a: Click here to view information from the Special Populations department about the school closure.

div.a: New to MISD? To help determine which campus your student will attend, please use our School Locator.

div.div: McKinney ISD is very fortunate to have a dedicated, hard working Board of Trustees. Each year our board members give countless hours of their personal time in service to our district. We have set up a photo gallery that aims to capture a few of the many events our board members attend throughout the year.
